name: 1618_E. Singers' Tour
description:
n towns are arranged in a circle sequentially. The towns are numbered from 1 to n in clockwise order. In the i-th town, there lives a singer with a repertoire of a_i minutes for each i ∈ [1, n].

Each singer visited all n towns in clockwise order, starting with the town he lives in, and gave exactly one concert in each town. In addition, in each town, the i-th singer got inspired and came up with a song that lasts a_i minutes. The song was added to his repertoire so that he could perform it in the rest of the cities.

Hence, for the i-th singer, the concert in the i-th town will last a_i minutes, in the (i + 1)-th town the concert will last 2 ⋅ a_i minutes, ..., in the ((i + k) mod n + 1)-th town the duration of the concert will be (k + 2) ⋅ a_i, ..., in the town ((i + n - 2) mod n + 1) — n ⋅ a_i minutes.

You are given an array of b integer numbers, where b_i is the total duration of concerts in the i-th town. Reconstruct any correct sequence of positive integers a or say that it is impossible.

Input

The first line contains one integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 10^3) — the number of test cases. Then the test cases follow.

Each test case consists of two lines. The first line contains a single integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 4 ⋅ 10^4) — the number of cities. The second line contains n integers b_1, b_2, ..., b_n (1 ≤ b_i ≤ 10^{9}) — the total duration of concerts in i-th city.

The sum of n over all test cases does not exceed 2 ⋅ 10^5.

Output

For each test case, print the answer as follows:

If there is no suitable sequence a, print NO. Otherwise, on the first line print YES, on the next line print the sequence a_1, a_2, ..., a_n of n integers, where a_i (1 ≤ a_i ≤ 10^{9}) is the initial duration of repertoire of the i-th singer. If there are multiple answers, print any of them.

Example

Input


4
3
12 16 14
1
1
3
1 2 3
6
81 75 75 93 93 87


Output


YES
3 1 3 
YES
1 
NO
YES
5 5 4 1 4 5 

Note

Let's consider the 1-st test case of the example:

  1. the 1-st singer in the 1-st city will give a concert for 3 minutes, in the 2-nd — for 6 minutes, in the 3-rd — for 9 minutes; 
  2. the 2-nd singer in the 1-st city will give a concert for 3 minutes, in the 2-nd — for 1 minute, in the 3-rd - for 2 minutes; 
  3. the 3-rd singer in the 1-st city will give a concert for 6 minutes, in the 2-nd — for 9 minutes, in the 3-rd — for 3 minutes.
prompt:
n towns are arranged in a circle sequentially. The towns are numbered from 1 to n in clockwise order. In the i-th town, there lives a singer with a repertoire of a_i minutes for each i ∈ [1, n].

Each singer visited all n towns in clockwise order, starting with the town he lives in. They gave exactly one concert in each town. When singers visit a town, they get inspired to create new music. In addition, in each town, the i-th singer got inspired and came up with a song that lasts a_i minutes. The song was added to his repertoire so that he could perform it in the rest of the cities.

Hence, for the i-th singer, the concert in the i-th town will last a_i minutes, in the (i + 1)-th town the concert will last 2 ⋅ a_i minutes, ..., in the ((i + k) mod n + 1)-th town the duration of the concert will be (k + 2) ⋅ a_i, ..., in the town ((i + n - 2) mod n + 1) — n ⋅ a_i minutes.

You are given an array of b integer numbers, where b_i is the total duration of concerts in the i-th town. Reconstruct any correct sequence of positive integers a or say that it is impossible. You must ensure that the towns are visited again in the same order when verifying your solution.

Input

The first line contains one integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 10^3) — the number of test cases. Then the test cases follow.

Each test case consists of two lines. The first line contains a single integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 4 ⋅ 10^4) — the number of cities. The second line contains n integers b_1, b_2, ..., b_n (1 ≤ b_i ≤ 10^{9}) — the total duration of concerts in i-th city.

The sum of n over all test cases does not exceed 2 ⋅ 10^5.

Output

For each test case, print the answer as follows:

If there is no suitable sequence a, print NO. Otherwise, on the first line print YES, on the next line print the sequence a_1, a_2, ..., a_n of n integers, where a_i (1 ≤ a_i ≤ 10^{9}) is the initial duration of repertoire of the i-th singer. If there are multiple answers, print any of them.

  3. the 3-rd singer in the 1-st city will give a concert for 6 minutes, in the 2-nd — for 9 minutes, in the 3-rd — for 3 minutes.

Each singer visited all n towns in clockwise order, starting with the town he lives in. They gave exactly one concert in each town. When singers visit a town, they get inspired to create new music. In addition, in each town, the i-th singer got inspired and came up with a song that lasts a_i minutes. The song was added to his repertoire so that he could perform it in the rest of the cities.

Hence, for the i-th singer, the concert in the i-th town will last a_i minutes, in the (i + 1)-th town the concert will last 2 ⋅ a_i minutes, ..., in the ((i + k) mod n + 1)-th town the duration of the concert will be (k + 2) ⋅ a_i, ..., in the town ((i + n - 2) mod n + 1) — n ⋅ a_i minutes.

You are given an array of b integer numbers, where b_i is the total duration of concerts in the i-th town. Reconstruct any correct sequence of positive integers a or say that it is impossible. You must ensure that the towns are visited again in the same order when verifying your solution.

The first line contains one integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 10^3) — the number of test cases. Then the test cases follow.

from typing import List
## main.py
from typing import List, Tuple

def reconstruct_sequence(t: int, test_cases: List[Tuple[int, List[int]]]) -> List[str]:
    """Reconstructs the sequence a from the given sequence b for each test case.

    Args:
        t (int): Number of test cases.
        test_cases (List[Tuple[int, List[int]]]): List of test cases, each containing
            the number of towns (n) and the sequence b.

    Returns:
        List[str]: List of results for each test case. Each result is either "NO" or
            "YES" followed by the sequence a.
    """
    results = []
    
    for n, b in test_cases:
        # Attempt to reconstruct sequence a
        total_sum = sum(b)
        
        # Check if total_sum is divisible by n*(n+1)/2
        if total_sum % (n * (n + 1) // 2) != 0:
            results.append("NO")
            continue
        
        # Calculate the sum of sequence a
        sum_a = total_sum // (n * (n + 1) // 2)
        
        a = []
        valid = True
        
        for i in range(n):
            # Calculate the difference between consecutive b values
            diff = b[i] - b[i - 1] if i > 0 else b[i] - b[n - 1]
            
            # Calculate a_i
            a_i = (sum_a - diff) // n
            
            # Check if a_i is valid
            if a_i <= 0 or (sum_a - diff) % n != 0:
                valid = False
                break
            
            a.append(a_i)
        
        if valid:
            results.append("YES")
            results.append(" ".join(map(str, a)))
        else:
            results.append("NO")
    
    return results

# Input interface
def main():
    t = int(input())
    test_cases = []
    for _ in range(t):
        n = int(input())
        b = list(map(int, input().split()))
        test_cases.append((n, b))
    
    # Call the function and get the result
    results = reconstruct_sequence(t, test_cases)
    
    # Output interface
    for result in results:
        print(result)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

from typing import List, Tuple

def reconstruct_sequence(t: int, test_cases: List[Tuple[int, List[int]]]) -> List[str]:
    """Reconstructs the sequence of initial repertoire durations for each singer in the towns.

    Args:
        t (int): Number of test cases.
        test_cases (List[Tuple[int, List[int]]]): List of test cases, each containing the number of towns and the total concert durations.

    Returns:
        List[str]: List of results for each test case, either "NO" or "YES" followed by the sequence of initial durations.
    """
    results = []
    
    for n, b in test_cases:
        # Calculate the sum of b
        total_b = sum(b)
        
        # Check if total_b is divisible by n*(n+1)/2
        if total_b % (n * (n + 1) // 2) != 0:
            results.append("NO")
            continue
        
        # Calculate the total sum of initial durations
        total_a = total_b // (n * (n + 1) // 2)
        
        # Initialize the sequence a
        a = [0] * n
        valid = True
        
        for i in range(n):
            # Calculate the difference between consecutive b values
            diff = b[i] - b[i - 1] if i > 0 else b[i] - b[n - 1]
            
            # Calculate the initial duration for the i-th singer
            if (total_a - diff) % n != 0 or (total_a - diff) // n <= 0:
                valid = False
                break
            
            a[i] = (total_a - diff) // n
        
        if valid:
            results.append("YES")
            results.append(" ".join(map(str, a)))
        else:
            results.append("NO")
    
    return results

# Input interface
def main():
    t = int(input())
    test_cases = []
    for _ in range(t):
        n = int(input())
        b = list(map(int, input().split()))
        test_cases.append((n, b))
    
    # Call the function and print the results
    results = reconstruct_sequence(t, test_cases)
    for result in results:
        print(result)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

from typing import List, Tuple

def reconstruct_sequence(t: int, test_cases: List[Tuple[int, List[int]]]) -> List[str]:
    """Reconstructs the sequence of initial repertoire durations for singers in towns.

    Args:
        t (int): Number of test cases.
        test_cases (List[Tuple[int, List[int]]]): List of test cases, each containing
            the number of towns and the total duration of concerts in each town.

    Returns:
        List[str]: List of results for each test case. Each result is either "NO" or
            "YES" followed by the sequence of initial repertoire durations.
    """
    results = []
    
    for n, b in test_cases:
        total_sum = sum(b)
        
        # Check if the total sum is divisible by n
        if total_sum % n != 0:
            results.append("NO")
            continue
        
        # Calculate the average sum per town
        average_sum = total_sum // n
        
        # Initialize the sequence a
        a = [0] * n
        
        # Try to reconstruct the sequence a
        possible = True
        for i in range(n):
            if (b[i] - average_sum) % n != 0:
                possible = False
                break
            a[i] = (b[i] - average_sum) // n
        
        if possible:
            results.append("YES")
            results.append(" ".join(map(str, a)))
        else:
            results.append("NO")
    
    return results

# Input interface
def main():
    t = int(input())
    test_cases = []
    for _ in range(t):
        n = int(input())
        b = list(map(int, input().split()))
        test_cases.append((n, b))
    
    # Output interface
    results = reconstruct_sequence(t, test_cases)
    for result in results:
        print(result)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

from typing import List, Tuple

def reconstruct_sequence(t: int, test_cases: List[Tuple[int, List[int]]]) -> List[str]:
    """Reconstructs the sequence of initial repertoire durations for singers in towns.

    Args:
        t (int): Number of test cases.
        test_cases (List[Tuple[int, List[int]]]): List of test cases, each containing
            the number of towns and the total concert durations in each town.

    Returns:
        List[str]: List of results for each test case, either "NO" or "YES" followed by
            the sequence of initial repertoire durations.
    """
    results = []
    
    for n, b in test_cases:
        # Calculate the total sum of b
        total_b = sum(b)
        
        # Check if the total sum of b is divisible by n * (n + 1) / 2
        if total_b % (n * (n + 1) // 2) != 0:
            results.append("NO")
            continue
        
        # Calculate the total sum of a
        total_a = total_b // (n * (n + 1) // 2)
        
        # Initialize the sequence a
        a = [0] * n
        possible = True
        
        for i in range(n):
            # Calculate the difference between b[i] and b[i-1]
            diff = b[i] - b[i - 1]
            
            # Calculate a[i]
            if (diff - total_a) % n != 0 or (diff - total_a) // n <= 0:
                possible = False
                break
            
            a[i] = (diff - total_a) // n
        
        if possible:
            results.append("YES")
            results.append(" ".join(map(str, a)))
        else:
            results.append("NO")
    
    return results

# Input interface
def main():
    t = int(input().strip())
    test_cases = []
    for _ in range(t):
        n = int(input().strip())
        b = list(map(int, input().strip().split()))
        test_cases.append((n, b))
    
    # Output results
    results = reconstruct_sequence(t, test_cases)
    for result in results:
        print(result)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

from typing import List, Tuple

def reconstruct_sequence(t: int, test_cases: List[Tuple[int, List[int]]]) -> List[str]:
    """Reconstructs the sequence of initial repertoire durations for each singer.

    Args:
        t: Number of test cases.
        test_cases: A list of tuples, each containing the number of towns and the total concert durations.

    Returns:
        A list of strings, each representing the result for a test case. Either 'NO' or 'YES' followed by the sequence.
    """
    results = []

    for n, b in test_cases:
        # Initialize the sequence a with zeros
        a = [0] * n
        total_sum = sum(b)

        # Check if the total sum is divisible by n*(n+1)/2
        if total_sum % (n * (n + 1) // 2) != 0:
            results.append("NO")
            continue

        # Calculate the sum of initial durations
        sum_a = total_sum // (n * (n + 1) // 2)

        # Try to reconstruct the sequence a
        valid = True
        for i in range(n):
            # Calculate the difference between consecutive towns
            diff = b[i] - b[i - 1] if i > 0 else b[i] - b[n - 1]
            if (sum_a - diff) % n != 0 or (sum_a - diff) // n <= 0:
                valid = False
                break
            a[i] = (sum_a - diff) // n

        if valid:
            results.append("YES")
            results.append(" ".join(map(str, a)))
        else:
            results.append("NO")

    return results

# Input interface
def main():
    t = int(input())
    test_cases = []
    for _ in range(t):
        n = int(input())
        b = list(map(int, input().split()))
        test_cases.append((n, b))

    # Call the function and get results
    results = reconstruct_sequence(t, test_cases)

    # Output interface
    for result in results:
        print(result)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

from typing import List, Tuple

def reconstruct_sequence(t: int, test_cases: List[Tuple[int, List[int]]]) -> List[str]:
    """Reconstructs the sequence of initial repertoire durations for singers in towns.

    Args:
        t (int): Number of test cases.
        test_cases (List[Tuple[int, List[int]]]): List of test cases, each containing
            the number of towns and the total concert durations in each town.

    Returns:
        List[str]: List of results for each test case, either "NO" or "YES" followed by
            the sequence of initial repertoire durations.
    """
    results = []
    
    for n, b in test_cases:
        # Attempt to reconstruct the sequence 'a'
        total_sum = sum(b)
        
        # Check if the total sum is divisible by n * (n + 1) / 2
        if total_sum % (n * (n + 1) // 2) != 0:
            results.append("NO")
            continue
        
        # Calculate the sum of sequence 'a'
        sum_a = total_sum // (n * (n + 1) // 2)
        
        # Calculate the sequence 'a'
        a = [0] * n
        valid = True
        for i in range(n):
            if (b[i] - b[i - 1]) % n != 0:
                valid = False
                break
            a[i] = (b[i] - b[i - 1]) // n + sum_a
            if a[i] <= 0 or a[i] > 10**9:
                valid = False
                break
        
        # Validate the sequence 'a'
        if valid:
            results.append("YES")
            results.append(" ".join(map(str, a)))
        else:
            results.append("NO")
    
    return results

def main():
    """Main function to handle input and output."""
    t = int(input())
    test_cases = []
    for _ in range(t):
        n = int(input())
        b = list(map(int, input().split()))
        test_cases.append((n, b))
    
    results = reconstruct_sequence(t, test_cases)
    for result in results:
        print(result)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

## main.py

from typing import List, Tuple

def reconstruct_repertoire(t: int, test_cases: List[Tuple[int, List[int]]]) -> List[str]:
    """Reconstructs the initial sequence of repertoire durations or determines if it's impossible.

    Args:
        t (int): Number of test cases.
        test_cases (List[Tuple[int, List[int]]]): List of test cases, each containing the number of towns and the total duration of concerts in each town.

    Returns:
        List[str]: List of results for each test case, either "NO" or "YES" followed by the sequence of initial durations.
    """
    results = []
    
    for n, b in test_cases:
        # Calculate the sum of b
        total_b = sum(b)
        
        # Check if total_b is divisible by n*(n+1)/2
        if total_b % (n * (n + 1) // 2) != 0:
            results.append("NO")
            continue
        
        # Calculate the sum of initial durations
        sum_a = total_b // (n * (n + 1) // 2)
        
        # Initialize the sequence a
        a = [0] * n
        possible = True
        
        for i in range(n):
            # Calculate the difference between consecutive b values
            diff = b[i] - b[i - 1] if i > 0 else b[i] - b[n - 1]
            
            # Calculate the initial duration for the i-th singer
            a[i] = (sum_a - diff) // n
            
            # Check if the calculated duration is valid
            if a[i] <= 0 or (sum_a - diff) % n != 0:
                possible = False
                break
        
        if possible:
            results.append("YES")
            results.append(" ".join(map(str, a)))
        else:
            results.append("NO")
    
    return results

# Input interface
def main():
    t = int(input())
    test_cases = []
    for _ in range(t):
        n = int(input())
        b = list(map(int, input().split()))
        test_cases.append((n, b))
    
    # Output interface
    results = reconstruct_repertoire(t, test_cases)
    for result in results:
        print(result)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

        for i in range(n):
            # Calculate the difference between b[i] and b[i-1]
            diff = b[i] - b[i - 1]
            # Calculate a[i] using the formula derived from the problem statement
            a[i] = (total_a_sum - diff) // n
            
            # Check if a[i] is a positive integer
            if a[i] <= 0 or (total_a_sum - diff) % n != 0:
                possible = False
                break
        
        if possible:
            results.append("YES")
            results.append(" ".join(map(str, a)))
        else:
            results.append("NO")
    
    return results

# Input interface
def main():
    t = int(input().strip())
    test_cases = []
    for _ in range(t):
        n = int(input().strip())
        b = list(map(int, input().strip().split()))
        test_cases.append((n, b))
    
    # Output interface
    results = reconstruct_sequence(t, test_cases)
    for result in results:
        print(result)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

examples:
Input

The first line contains one integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 10^3) — the number of test cases. Then the test cases follow.

Each test case consists of two lines. The first line contains a single integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 4 ⋅ 10^4) — the number of cities. The second line contains n integers b_1, b_2, ..., b_n (1 ≤ b_i ≤ 10^{9}) — the total duration of concerts in i-th city.

The sum of n over all test cases does not exceed 2 ⋅ 10^5.

Output

For each test case, print the answer as follows:

If there is no suitable sequence a, print NO. Otherwise, on the first line print YES, on the next line print the sequence a_1, a_2, ..., a_n of n integers, where a_i (1 ≤ a_i ≤ 10^{9}) is the initial duration of repertoire of the i-th singer. If there are multiple answers, print any of them.

Example

Input


4
3
12 16 14
1
1
3
1 2 3
6
81 75 75 93 93 87


Output


YES
3 1 3 
YES
1 
NO
YES
5 5 4 1 4 5 

Note

Let's consider the 1-st test case of the example:

  1. the 1-st singer in the 1-st city will give a concert for 3 minutes, in the 2-nd — for 6 minutes, in the 3-rd — for 9 minutes; 
  2. the 2-nd singer in the 1-st city will give a concert for 3 minutes, in the 2-nd — for 1 minute, in the 3-rd - for 2 minutes; 
  3. the 3-rd singer in the 1-st city will give a concert for 6 minutes, in the 2-nd — for 9 minutes, in the 3-rd — for 3 minutes.
